verses.text_plain: And he heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying, Jacob hath taken away all that was our father’s; and of that which was our father’s hath he gotten all this glory.
verses.verse_html: 1And he heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying, Jacob hath taken away all that was our father’s; and of that which was our father’s hath he gotten all this glory.

verses.text_plain: And Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.
verses.verse_html:
2And Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as before. ▼
▼ as before: Heb. as yesterday and the day before

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as before: Heb. as yesterday and the day before
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as before: Heb. as yesterday and the day before

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.
verses.verse_html: 3And the Lord said unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.

verses.text_plain: And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his flock,
verses.verse_html: 4And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his flock,

verses.text_plain: And said unto them, I see your father’s countenance, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father hath been with me.
verses.verse_html: 5And said unto them, I see your father’s countenance, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father hath been with me.

verses.text_plain: And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.
verses.verse_html: 6And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.

verses.text_plain: And your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered him not to hurt me.
verses.verse_html: 7And your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered him not to hurt me.

verses.text_plain: If he said thus, The speckled shall be thy wages; then all the cattle bare speckled: and if he said thus, The ringstraked shall be thy hire; then bare all the cattle ringstraked.
verses.verse_html: 8If he said thus, The speckled shall be thy wages; then all the cattle bare speckled: and if he said thus, The ringstraked shall be thy hire; then bare all the cattle ringstraked.

verses.text_plain: Thus God hath taken away the cattle of your father, and given them to me.
verses.verse_html: 9Thus God hath taken away the cattle of your father, and given them to me.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass at the time that the cattle conceived, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the rams which leaped upon the cattle were ringstraked, speckled, and grisled.
verses.verse_html:
10And it came to pass at the time that the cattle conceived, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the rams which leaped upon the cattle were ringstraked, speckled, and grisled. ▼
▼ rams: or, he goats

tokens.text: And it came to pass at the time

footnotes.body_html: ▼ rams: or, he goats

verses.text_plain: And the angel of God spake unto me in a dream, saying, Jacob: And I said, Here am I.
verses.verse_html: 11And the angel of God spake unto me in a dream, saying, Jacob: And I said, Here am I.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the rams which leap upon the cattle are ringstraked, speckled, and grisled: for I have seen all that Laban doeth unto thee.
verses.verse_html: 12And he said, Lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the rams which leap upon the cattle are ringstraked, speckled, and grisled: for I have seen all that Laban doeth unto thee.

verses.text_plain: I am the God of Beth–el, where thou anointedst the pillar, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.
verses.verse_html: 13I am the God of Beth–el, where thou anointedst the pillar, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.

verses.text_plain: And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father’s house?
verses.verse_html: 14And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father’s house?

verses.text_plain: Are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our money.
verses.verse_html: 15Are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our money.

verses.text_plain: For all the riches which God hath taken from our father, that is ours, and our children’s: now then, whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do.
verses.verse_html: 16For all the riches which God hath taken from our father, that is ours, and our children’s: now then, whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do.

verses.text_plain: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;
verses.verse_html: 17Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;

verses.text_plain: And he carried away all his cattle, and all his goods which he had gotten, the cattle of his getting, which he had gotten in Padan–aram, for to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.
verses.verse_html: 18And he carried away all his cattle, and all his goods which he had gotten, the cattle of his getting, which he had gotten in Padan–aram, for to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.

verses.text_plain: And Laban went to shear his sheep: and Rachel had stolen the images that were her father’s.
verses.verse_html:
19And Laban went to shear his sheep: and Rachel had stolen the images that were her father’s. ▼
▼ images: Heb. teraphim

verses.text_plain: And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.
verses.verse_html:
20And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled. ▼
▼ unawares…: Heb. the heart of Laban

footnotes.body_text: ▼ unawares…: Heb. the heart of Laban
footnotes.body_html: ▼ unawares…: Heb. the heart of Laban

verses.text_plain: So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the river, and set his face toward the mount Gilead.
verses.verse_html: 21So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the river, and set his face toward the mount Gilead.

tokens.text: with all that he had; and he rose up

verses.text_plain: And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob was fled.
verses.verse_html: 22And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob was fled.

verses.text_plain: And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days’ journey; and they overtook him in the mount Gilead.
verses.verse_html: 23And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days’ journey; and they overtook him in the mount Gilead.

verses.text_plain: And God came to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
verses.verse_html:
24And God came to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad. ▼
▼ either…: Heb. from good to bad

footnotes.body_text: ▼ either…: Heb. from good to bad
footnotes.body_html: ▼ either…: Heb. from good to bad

verses.text_plain: Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban with his brethren pitched in the mount of Gilead.
verses.verse_html: 25Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban with his brethren pitched in the mount of Gilead.

verses.text_plain: And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my daughters, as captives taken with the sword?
verses.verse_html: 26And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my daughters, as captives taken with the sword?

verses.text_plain: Wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp?
verses.verse_html:
27Wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp? ▼
▼ steal…: Heb. hast stolen me

tokens.text: from me; and didst not tell
me, that I might have sent thee away

footnotes.body_html: ▼ steal…: Heb. hast stolen me

verses.text_plain: And hast not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters? thou hast now done foolishly in so doing.
verses.verse_html: 28And hast not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters? thou hast now done foolishly in so doing.

verses.text_plain: It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, Take thou heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
verses.verse_html: 29It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, Take thou heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.

verses.text_plain: And now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father’s house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?
verses.verse_html: 30And now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father’s house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?

verses.text_plain: And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid: for I said, Peradventure thou wouldest take by force thy daughters from me.
verses.verse_html: 31And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid: for I said, Peradventure thou wouldest take by force thy daughters from me.

verses.text_plain: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.
verses.verse_html: 32With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.

verses.text_plain: And Laban went into Jacob’s tent, and into Leah’s tent, and into the two maidservants’ tents; but he found them not. Then went he out of Leah’s tent, and entered into Rachel’s tent.
verses.verse_html: 33And Laban went into Jacob’s tent, and into Leah’s tent, and into the two maidservants’ tents; but he found them not. Then went he out of Leah’s tent, and entered into Rachel’s tent.

verses.text_plain: Now Rachel had taken the images, and put them in the camel’s furniture, and sat upon them. And Laban searched all the tent, but found them not.
verses.verse_html:
34Now Rachel had taken the images, and put them in the camel’s furniture, and sat upon them. And Laban searched all the tent, but found them not. ▼
▼ searched: Heb. felt

verses.text_plain: And she said to her father, Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise up before thee; for the custom of women is upon me. And he searched, but found not the images.
verses.verse_html: 35And she said to her father, Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise up before thee; for the custom of women is upon me. And he searched, but found not the images.

verses.text_plain: And Jacob was wroth, and chode with Laban: and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?
verses.verse_html: 36And Jacob was wroth, and chode with Laban: and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?

tokens.text: that thou hast so hotly pursued

verses.text_plain: Whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? set it here before my brethren and thy brethren, that they may judge betwixt us both.
verses.verse_html:
37Whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? set it here before my brethren and thy brethren, that they may judge betwixt us both. ▼
▼ searched: Heb. felt

verses.text_plain: This twenty years have I been with thee; thy ewes and thy she goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flock have I not eaten.
verses.verse_html: 38This twenty years have I been with thee; thy ewes and thy she goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flock have I not eaten.

verses.text_plain: That which was torn of beasts I brought not unto thee; I bare the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night.
verses.verse_html: 39That which was torn of beasts I brought not unto thee; I bare the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night.

tokens.text: not unto thee; I bare the loss

verses.text_plain: Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from mine eyes.
verses.verse_html: 40Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from mine eyes.

verses.text_plain: Thus have I been twenty years in thy house; I served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters, and six years for thy cattle: and thou hast changed my wages ten times.
verses.verse_html: 41Thus have I been twenty years in thy house; I served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters, and six years for thy cattle: and thou hast changed my wages ten times.

verses.text_plain: Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away now empty. God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
verses.verse_html: 42Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away now empty. God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.

tokens.text: had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away

verses.text_plain: And Laban answered and said unto Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these children are my children, and these cattle are my cattle, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or unto their children which they have born?
verses.verse_html: 43And Laban answered and said unto Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these children are my children, and these cattle are my cattle, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or unto their children which they have born?

tokens.text: mine: and what can I do

verses.text_plain: Now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
verses.verse_html: 44Now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.

tokens.text: I and thou; and let it be for a witness

verses.text_plain: And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.
verses.verse_html: 45And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.

verses.text_plain: And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap.
verses.verse_html: 46And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap.

verses.text_plain: And Laban called it Jegar–sahadutha: but Jacob called it Galeed.
verses.verse_html:
47And Laban called it Jegar–sahadutha: but Jacob called it Galeed. ▼
▼ Jegar–sahadutha: that is, The heap of witness, Chaldee
 , ▼
▼ Galeed: that is, The heap of witness, Heb.

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Jegar–sahadutha: that is, The heap of witness, Chaldee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Jegar–sahadutha: that is, The heap of witness, Chaldee

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Galeed: that is, The heap of witness, Heb.
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Galeed: that is, The heap of witness, Heb.

verses.text_plain: And Laban said, This heap is a witness between me and thee this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed;
verses.verse_html: 48And Laban said, This heap is a witness between me and thee this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed;

tokens.text: between me and thee this day

verses.text_plain: And Mizpah; for he said, The Lord watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another.
verses.verse_html:
49And Mizpah; for he said, The Lord watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another. ▼
▼ Mizpah: that is, A beacon, or, watchtower

tokens.text: between me and thee, when we are absent

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Mizpah: that is, A beacon, or, watchtower
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Mizpah: that is, A beacon, or, watchtower

verses.text_plain: If thou shalt afflict my daughters, or if thou shalt take other wives beside my daughters, no man is with us; see, God is witness betwixt me and thee.
verses.verse_html: 50If thou shalt afflict my daughters, or if thou shalt take other wives beside my daughters, no man is with us; see, God is witness betwixt me and thee.

verses.text_plain: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee;
verses.verse_html: 51And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee;

verses.text_plain: This heap be witness, and this pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me, for harm.
verses.verse_html: 52This heap be witness, and this pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me, for harm.

tokens.text: that I will not pass over
to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over

verses.text_plain: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge betwixt us. And Jacob sware by the fear of his father Isaac.
verses.verse_html: 53The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge betwixt us. And Jacob sware by the fear of his father Isaac.

verses.text_plain: Then Jacob offered sacrifice upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount.
verses.verse_html:
54Then Jacob offered sacrifice upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount. ▼
▼ offered…: or, killed beasts

footnotes.body_html: ▼ offered…: or, killed beasts

verses.text_plain: And early in the morning Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them: and Laban departed, and returned unto his place.
verses.verse_html: 55And early in the morning Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them: and Laban departed, and returned unto his place.
